li.a: Watch this space for important notifications.

div.p: North Harrison Updates - April 15, 2020
Shout out to parents, students, teachers, meal prep workers, delivery crews, and all of North Harrison for the great work you are doing for our school and community! Way to go!
I want to provide information on some items of interest.

Graduation and Prom - Since prom and graduation will not take place on their original dates, the following dates and alternative dates have been set for prom and graduation. We are hopeful both events can take place in June, but we went ahead and set July dates so families can hold these dates available. If a traditional graduation cannot take place June 20 or July 25, an alternative graduation will take place on July 25. If prom cannot take place on June 26 or July 17, it will be cancelled.
Graduation Saturday, June 20, 2020 at 2:00
Graduation Alt Date Saturday, July 25, 2020 at 2:00
Prom Friday, June 26, 2020
Prom Alt Date Friday, July 17, 2020

Return of school items and retrieval of personal items - Plans for this will be released at a later date. This will not take place until after May 15. The process for this will be dependent upon guidance at the time from the health department and state and local officials.
Meals - May 13 will be the last date for meal delivery since May 14 was scheduled as our last day of school.

Bills - please check your account for amounts you owe for this year. You can pay with a credit card within Teacherease which is the preferred method of payment at this time. You may also mail a check to the school.
Keep up the great work. I miss and appreciate all of you.
Dr. Todd Willhite

h3.a: Governor Announces School Closure for Remainder of Year

div.p: Earlier today, the Governor announced school buildings will remain closed for the remainder of this school year. He said meal service and instruction should continue until our planned last day of school. We will be working on adjusting our plans due to this announcement. I know there will be questions about instruction, meals, graduation, books/chromebook returns, etc. We will be working on answers and plans and will share those in the near future. Thank you for your continued support and understanding.

a.aria-label: Read more about Governor Announces School Closure for Remainder of Year

div.p: North Harrison R-III is currently accepting applications for:

North Harrison is looking for a 7-12 special education instructor. This is an immediate opening and is also available for the 2020 - 2021 school year. This is a full-time position. The special education teacher will be responsible for, but not limited to maintaining student records, planning and implementing individualized instruction, communicating effectively with parents, career planning, and be able to work as a team with other teachers in the district. The successful candidate will hold appropriate credentials and a Missouri certificate. Qualified applicants should contact Central Office at 660-867-5221 and request an application or you may download an application from the district website.
Substitute Teachers
Substitute Bus Drivers

Applications are available at www.nhr3.net, by contacting the district office or Early Childhood Center office at 660-867-5222, or by email at superintendent@nhr3.net. All positions are open until filled. EOE

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 13:53 pm CDT

div.p: This Afternoon
div.span: Sunny, with a high near 59. North northeast wind 10 to 13 mph.

div.p: Tonight
div.span: A slight chance of rain after 5am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 38. North northeast wind 5 to 7 mph becoming calm after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 10%.

div.p: Monday
div.span: A chance of rain, mainly between 8am and 2pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 63. Light southwest wind becoming west 9 to 14 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
